attributes.action: close the non-domicile loophole that allows foreign nationals to avoid paying UK Income Tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This loophole allows non-British born residents who make money abroad to avoid tax, as long as their income is not brought into the UK. In many cases it is kept in offshore tax havens. In most countries, overseas residents are subject to the host nation’s tax regime. 

It is unclear whether the recent judgement in the case of Agassi v Robinson (HMRC) might create a precedent to close this loophole.
